articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Ski Resort on Masik Pass
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Ski Resort on Masik Pass
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and  supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Ski Resort on Masik Pass built successfully as a great monumental structure in the era of Songun.
					 He went round Masik Pass Hotel and ski service and lodging buildings.
					
					 He dropped in at a restaurant, shop, publications shop, stand, etc. to learn in detail about the preparations for service and its plan.
					
					 All service facilities have been arranged in such a manner as to suit the desire and requirements of people and their emotion and architectural needs and provide the visitors with the best convenience, he said, noting with great satisfaction that the features of the area of the Masik Pass are preserved well and everything is impeccable.
					
					 He went up to the top of the pass by a ski lift to check its safety and convenience.
					
					 He learned about the performance of the snow-hardening vehicle, snow gun and other equipment.
					
					 He gave instructions to take good care of the equipment and facilities of the ski resort and serve the people well so that the visitors may keenly feel the loving care of the party.
					
					 He said that everything in the ski resort was built on the highest level, preserving the natural ecological environment in hearty response to the call of the times for pushing back the frontiers of high civilization and architecture.
					
					 He repeatedly appreciated the feats the soldier-builders performed by building one more monumental structure in the era of the WPK.
					
					 He instructed officials to hold an opening ceremony as early as possible so that people can fully enjoy skiing as the ski resort was built on the standard set by the party.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kang Sok Ju, Kim Yang Gon, Han Kwang Sang, Jon Il Chun, Ri Jae Il, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Pyong Ho, Ma Won Chun and Pak Myong Chol.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to Raul Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message on Tuesday to Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations and comradely greetings to you and, through you, to all Cuban people on the 55th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution.
					
					 The Korean people are sincerely pleased that the fraternal Cuban people are firmly defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country and stepping up the building of socialism, resolutely foiling all challenges and obstructive moves of the hostile forces at home and abroad under the leadership of Comrade Fidel Castro and you.
					
					 Convinced that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between our two countries will steadily grow strong in the efforts for the victory of the cause of independence against imperialism and the cause of socialism, I wholeheartedly wish you good health and bigger success in your responsible work for leading the Cuban party and government.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a floral basket to the Cuban embassy here on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution.
					 The floral basket was handed to Cuban Ambassador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez on Tuesday.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Russian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Russian President
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy to Russian President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin on Tuesday in connection with terrorist acts that occurred in Volgograd of the Russian Federation, claiming huge casualties.
					 Kim in his message expressed deep condolences to the Russian president, victims and their bereaved families. 
					
					 Reiterating the DPRK's stand of opposing all forms of terrorism, the message extended solidarity to the government and people of Russia in their efforts to eradicate the aftereffects of the terrorist acts and ensure solid stability of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Mahmoud Abbas, president of the State of Palestine and chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization, on December 24.
					 In the message the Palestinian president said he was pleased to extend warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the state and people of Palestine and on his own behalf on the New Year.
					
					 The president sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the DPRK and its people prosperity and stability.
					
					 The president expressed hope that the peoples of all regions would live in peace in the relationship of stability, security and good neighborliness. 
					
					 He extended sincerest congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of State of Kuwait
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of State of Kuwait
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Sabah Al－Ahmad Al－Jaber Al－Sabah, emir of the State of Kuwait, on December 27.
					 The emir in his message said that he was pleased to extend sincerest congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un on the New Year 2014.
					
					 Sharing good feelings with Your Excellency on this occasion, I hope the new year will be a happy year of peace, security, well-being and prosperity for all peoples around the world, the message said. 
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and expressed hope that the good relations between the two countries and two peoples would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Iranian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Iranian President
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Hassan Rouhani, president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, on Monday.
					 The president said he was delighted to extend warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of the New Year 2014.
					
					 He hoped that the two sides would pool their minds and efforts to achieve the global peace, security and stability and strengthen the friendly relations among nations and tribes in the New Year.
					
					 Hoping that the New Year will be a year full of development and happiness, he wished Kim Jong Un good health and success in his work and the Korean people prosperity and glory.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian President
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Adli Mahmoud Mansour, president of the Arab Republic of Egypt, on December 19.
					 The message said that he was very pleased to extend sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the New Year, 2014.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Congratulations from Moldovan Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Congratulations from Moldovan Political Party Leader
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- First Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Vladimir Voronin, chairman of the Central Committee of the Party of Communists of the Moldovan Republic, on December 26.
					 The chairman in his message extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of his party on the occasion of the New Year 2014.
					
					 Noting people always greet a new year in happiness though they underwent difficulties in the dying year, the message said:
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I wish you good health, fresh successes and victory, and all Korean people happiness and prosperity.
					
					 Our two fraternal countries will live in peace, harmony and quiet.
					
					 I wish you all the best in the New Year 2014.

articles.title: New Year Cards to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
New Year Cards to Kim Jong Un 
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received New Year cards from leaders of political parties and heads of state across the world on the occasion of the New Year Juche 103 (2014).
					 They included the president of Russian Federation, president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic, president of Mongolia, president of the Republic of Armenia, president of the Republic of Indonesia and his family, president of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, king of Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan and his wife, president of the Republic of Uganda and his wife, chairman of the Mongolian People's Party, chairman of A Just Russia, chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia and the first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Canada (Marxist-Leninist).
					
					 Cards also came from the national secretary of the Socialist Workers' Party of United States of America, governor of the Khabarovsk Territory Administration of Russia, director of the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company of Russia and the UN secretary general.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Gifts, New Year Card from Russian Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Gifts, New Year Card from Russian Figures 
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift and New Year card from S. M. Mironov, chairman of "A Just Russia", and a gift from Yazov, former minister of Defense of the Soviet Union, on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 103 (2014).
					 They were conveyed respectively to the DPRK ambassador to Russia and an embassy official on Dec. 24.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un from Peruvian Figure, Widow of DPRK Hero
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un from Peruvian Figure, Widow of DPRK Hero
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received floral baskets from Estuardo Martinez Perez, president of the General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institute, and Jong Il Sim, widow of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, Tuesday on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 103 (2014).

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 103 (2014).
					 They were handed to Jang Jong Nam, minister of the People's Armed Forces, by military attache of the Iranian embassy Hassan Reza Husseini who is doyen of the corps on Tuesday.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Sent to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Russian Paper and Overseas Korean
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Russian Paper and Overseas Korean
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Patriot and Jong Il Sim, widow of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, sent floral baskets to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 103 (2014).
					 Floral baskets were laid before the statues on Tuesday.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Nigerian embassy and the mission of the United Nations Development Programme here laid floral baskets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill and paid tribute to them on Tuesday on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 103 (2014).

articles.title: Ministries, National Institution Send Floral Baskets to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Ministries, National Institution Send Floral Baskets to Cuban Embassy
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Ministries and a national institution of the DPRK sent floral baskets to the Cuban embassy here on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution.
					 Baskets in the name of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Foreign Trade and the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries were respectively handed to German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, on Tuesday.

articles.title: DPRK Students Prove Successful at Int'l Program Contests This Year
articles.content:
DPRK Students Prove Successful at Int'l Program Contests This Year
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Students of the DPRK have distinguished themselves in different Internet program contests this year.
					 Students of Kim Il Sung University took the first place in Codeforces sponsored by Russia in July and Codechef by India in August, September and October.
					
					 Netizens sent them such praises as "Kim Il Sung University is one of the first-class universities of the world" and "Hurrah for Kim Il Sung University!"
					
					 Students of Kim Chaek University of Technology also won the title with overwhelming marks at a competition topping the world-famous eight online program contests. 
					
					 They attended the competition for the first time, but got full marks of 10 points.
					
					 Students of University of Sciences were the first to give correct answers to 10 algorithms at a world online contest for program challengers held in March.
					
					 They also won the gold prize in the Asian regional contest for the 38th ICPC to be qualified for the ICPC finals due in June 2014.
					
					 Such achievements provide a glimpse of the Juche-based education breaking through the cutting edge.

articles.title: Strong Sports Enthusiasm Widespread in DPRK This Year
articles.content:
Strong Sports Enthusiasm Widespread in DPRK This Year
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Many sporting events have been held in the DPRK this year under the far-reaching plan of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) for turning the country into a sports power.
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un watched some of them to fan up sports enthusiasm throughout the country.
					
					 He watched the sports contest of health workers held to mark May Day and the final matches in popular sports events for the National Sports Contest of Provincial Teams at Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on October 10, the 68th anniversary of the WPK. And he stressed the need to organize such contest of provincial teams on a regular basis and direct efforts to traditional sports games so that everyone can make positive contribution to labor and defence in good health.
					
					 His energetic guidance brought a hot wind of sports activities all over the country.
					
					 A table-tennis contest of officials of commissions, ministries and national institutions was held at Pyongyang Indoor Stadium in January.
					
					 Then there took place a national sports contest of workers, a national basketball contest of agricultural workers to celebrate the Day of the Sun and other sports events which fully displayed the validity and vitality of the WPK's policy of popularizing physical culture and sports and making them part of daily life.
					
					 Volleyball and basketball courts and sports parks across the country have always been crowded with people.
					
					 Many people, including schoolchildren, have visited the Rungna People's Sports Park, built in May, to play various sporting games.
					
					 September witnessed the 11th Grand Bull Prize National Ssirum Contest on picturesque Rungna Islet.
					
					 Such mass sports activities are indicative of the Korean people's strong will to turn the country into a sports power.

articles.title: Public Catering Establishments Busy with Preparations for New Year's Day Service
articles.content:
Public Catering Establishments Busy with Preparations for New Year's Day Service
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Public catering establishments here are busy with preparations for the New Year's Day service.
					 The officials under the General Bureau of Public Service are paying deep attention to making citizens keenly feel the loving care for the people shown by the Workers' Party of Korea through the service.
					
					 There was a display of different dishes at Chongnyu Restaurant on Dec. 26 with the attendance of relevant experts from the establishments.
					
					 Pang Ung Gil, a deputy department director of the bureau, told KCNA that citizens will enjoy various kinds of nutritious and tasty dishes like noodle in flat vessel with meat, noodle with pheasant meat, roe steak, Sinsollo (traditional Korean dish), terrapin, sturgeon and salmon food at Okryu and Chongnyu restaurants and other establishments during the New Year holidays. 
					
					 Stalls on streets will serve roast chestnuts and sweet potatoes to please citizens, he said.
					
					 He said that restaurants in the city are likely to be crowded with people.
					
					 Over 10 restaurants under the Changgwang Public Service Management Bureau will serve rice-cake soup, entrails soup, steamed crab and others, he added.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Fascist Crackdown on Workers' Strike: News Analyst
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Fascist Crackdown on Workers' Strike: News Analyst
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet conservative regime has been hell bent on suppression of the general strike launched by the railway trade unionists and other popular masses in demand for the right to existence.
					 The south Korean authorities held a consultative meeting on security measures for the first time after taking power, at which they branded the strike illegal, and invoked all power bodies to toughen the crackdown upon railway workers. Therefore, the Ministry of Justice, the Police Agency and the Security Administration and other fascist repressive machines have turned out in the crackdown.
					
					 They have brought over 190 unionists to the court and dismissed more than 8 500 workers.
					
					 On Dec. 22, they called out at least 5 000 riot policemen to break the entrance door of the headquarters of the Confederation of Trade Unions with a hammer and spread tear liquid in a bid to arrest hardcore unionists. Not content with this, the riot police took away one hundred and scores of unionists.
					
					 On Dec. 24, the south Korean chief executive gave an instruction to take tough actions against the strike by mobilizing most of the police forces. It is a fascist suppression that can be done only by the descendants of the "Yusin" dictator.
					
					 Amnesty International has criticized the mobilization of police forces against the strike as a flagrant violation of the international standard.
					
					 It is so natural for the railway workers to down tools in protest against the "government's" plan for privatization of the railway sector, which would favor plutocrats only.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are sticking to anti-popular oppressive rules in disregard of the demand and interests of popular masses.
					
					 During the presidential election campaign, the present chief executive made a lot of flattering commitments like "economic democracy" and "welfare", but none of them has been implemented until now.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group's brutal suppression of the bare-handed protesters has enraged south Korean people.
					
					 The Confederation of Trade Unions denounced the brutal suppression as a declaration of war against all south Korean workers and declared that it would start an indefinite strike to depose Park from the "presidency". And it went into actions such as massive candlelight rallies and a grand meeting of one million people on the situation.
					
					 In support of the strike, the Democratic and other opposition parties and 1 280 civic organizations have staged all-people rallies and candlelight demonstrations one after another. Joining in them are students from scores of universities including Seoul National University, hundreds of thousands of civilians and even students of high schools.
					
					 The strike of the railway workers coincides with the growing anger of the south Korean people at the present regime over its illegal election, moves of reviving the "Yusin" dictatorship and deceptive election commitments, thus shaking Park's regime to its foundations.
					
					 It is self-evident that those who go against the interests of popular masses can never go scot-free.

articles.title: Halt to Moves for Reviving "Yusin" Dictatorship Demanded
articles.content:
Halt to Moves for Reviving "Yusin" Dictatorship Demanded 
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The Workers and Peasants Department of the Central Committee of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front made public an appeal to all workers of south Korea on Dec. 29, according to the website Kuguk Jonson.
					 The workers and other people are bitterly denouncing the conservative group for pressing forward the privatization of railway service despite the strong opposition of all people and turning south Korean society into "yusin" dictatorial society where fascism is rampant, the appeal said.
					
					 The general strike of workers, an event titled "day of one-million citizens' action" and large-scale action staged with more than 30 000 workers and families involved in Seoul and other parts of south Korea are not only struggles against the privatization of railway service but do-or-die actions against the dictatorial forces and for democracy and vital rights, it noted.
					
					 It called upon all people to brand the fascist authorities' barbarous suppression of the struggle against the privatization of railway service as a declaration of the "emergency martial law" in the era of the "yusin" dictatorship and resolutely shatter the moves.
					
					 It called for condemning the conservative group's hypocritical commitments full of lies, bringing down the violent regime, which lacks in understanding, through all-people action and leading the action against the privatization of railway service to the action against the "Saenuri Party".
					
					 The appeal underscored the need for all people to turn out in the action for resolutely checking and frustrating the moves of the conservative group to revive the "yusin" dictatorship, full of conviction of certain victory and optimism, and thus bring earlier a new democratic society and system where the working people become masters.

articles.title: Special Write-up Carried by Newspaper of Koreans in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Special Write-up Carried by Newspaper of Koreans in Uzbekistan
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Thongil, the newspaper of Koreans in Uzbekistan, carried a special write-up on Dec. 26.
					 It said that many people from all walks of life in the DPRK visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun where leader Kim Jong Il lies in state and the statues of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the second anniversary of Kim Jong Il's demise and paid high tribute. It gave an account of memorial services.
					
					 December 30 marks the second anniversary of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army, it said.
					
					 It carried a photo of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu, in military uniform with a broad smile on her face on the occasion of the 96th anniversary of her birth.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Observed in Foreign Countries 
						
Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to celebrate the 22nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and the second anniversary of Marshal Kim Jong Un's assumption of the same post.
					 They included meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows in Germany, Angola, Russia, Iran and Nigeria between December 21 and 24.
					
					 On display in the venues of the events were photos documenting exploits Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un performed in leading the army.
					
					 Also displayed there were books and photos introducing the invincible might of the heroic KPA and the real picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 Present there were figures of various social strata and other people of relevant countries. Staff members of the DPRK missions in the relevant countries were among those present there on invitation.
					
					 Films shown included "The Tower of the Juche Idea" and "Pyongyang Today".
					
					 The chairman of the Communist Party of Germany said that socialism in the DPRK is making a long drive as Kim Jong Il held aloft the banner of Songun and weathered all sorts of trials of history.
					
					 The director for foreign relations of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola said that President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk whom the Korean people always hold in high esteem are prominent great persons who brought freedom and sovereignty to the Korean people and fully demonstrated the dignity and pride of the nation.
					
					 The vice mayor of Nakhodka City of Russia noted the DPRK's single-minded unity will always remain unbreakable thanks to Kim Jong Un, who has made ceaseless journeys for field inspection to meet soldiers, braving the danger to his own safety.
					
					 The president of the International Taekwon-Do Association in Iran wished the Korean people greater success in building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un firmly defending the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Observed by Foreign Papers
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers dedicated special write-ups from Dec. 18 to 24 to the 22nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the second anniversary of Marshal Kim Jong Un's assumption of the same post.
					 The Lao paper Congtap Pasason Lao carried an article titled "Eternal Chairman of National Defence Commission." It was illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Il reviewing columns of paraders.
					
					 It said that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a military power with matchless military capability through his energetic Songun revolutionary leadership and consolidated the political and ideological position of the country, ushering in a new era of building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Blits edited articles illustrated with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It in an article titled "Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism" said that the Korean people are full of will to keep advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism indicated by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Bangla Times carried an article praising the feats of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Russian paper Vladivostok allotted a whole page to an article on Songun revolutionary leadership feats Kim Jong Un has performed for strengthening and developing the revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 It was accompanied by a photo of him saluting paraders.
					
					 Russian papers Komsomolskaya Pravda and Pri Armurskiye Wedomostsi carried articles titled "Leader loving future," etc. dealing with his noble outlook on the younger generation. They were illustrated with photos documenting his revolutionary activities.

articles.title: ITAR-TASS Introduces Okryu Children's Hospital in DPRK
articles.content:
ITAR-TASS Introduces Okryu Children's Hospital in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- ITAR-TASS on Dec. 26 introduced Okryu Children's Hospital built as a world-class healthcare center for children under the loving care of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 It said:
					
					 Okryu Children's Hospital in the capital city of the DPRK was built in a matter of a little over 9 months, a miraculous speed.
					
					 It has a total floor space of 32 800 square meters.
					
					 It has operation rooms, wards with TV sets and refrigerators, classrooms, resting rooms, playrooms, a heliport and baby treatment room.
					
					 It has also facilities for treating new-born babies.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre campo de esqui de monte Masik
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre campo de esqui de monte Masik
						
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea recorrio el campo de esqui del monte Masik, culminado como una creacion monumental de la epoca del Songun.
					Estuvo primero en el Hotel del monte Masik y los edificios de servicio de esqui y alojamiento.
					
					Luego, paso por el comedor, la tienda, la otra de publicaciones, el quiosco y otros lugares, ocasion en la cual hizo detallado conocimiento sobre el estado de preparacion para el servicio y su plan.
					
					Diciendo que todas las instalaciones de servicio son convenientes a la aspiracion, la demanda, el sentimiento y el gusto del pueblo y estan acondicionados perfectamente para facilitar las comodidades de los visitantes, se mostro muy satisfecho de que se haya destacado la peculiaridad de la zona del monte Masik y todos son perfectos.
					
					Subio en teleferico a la cima averiguando la seguridad y la comodidad.
					
					Y examino la funcion de las instalaciones inclusive la apisonadora, el canon de nieve y otros.
					
					Instruyo que los servidores del campo de esqui deben proteger y cuidar bien las instalaciones y los edificios del lugar y organizar con esmero sus actividades para que los habitantes disfruten de las benevolencias del partido.
					
					Subrayo que el campo fue construido mejor  manteniendo el habitat natural al satisfacer la demanda de la epoca de superar lo sofisticado de la civilizacion y la construccion.
					
					Evaluo reiteradamente las proezas de los constructores militares quienes irguieron la otra creacion monumental de la epoca del partido del trabajo.
					
					Ya que la obra fue terminada conforme a la demanda del partido, deben inaugurarlo lo mas pronto posible para que los habitantes, jovenes y ninos cultiven a su antojo sus cuerpos fisicos.
					
					Le acompanaron Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kang Sok Ju, Kim Yang Gon, Han Kwang Sang, Jon Il Chun, Ri Jae Il, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Pyong Ho, Ma Won Chun y Pak Myong Chol.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz 
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 31 un mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y Presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba. 
					El texto sigue: 
					
					En ocasion del 55o aniversario del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana, extiendo calida felicitacion y saludo camaraderil a Vd. y por su conducto, a todo el pueblo cubano. 
					
					Nuestro pueblo esta complacido de que bajo la direccion del companero Fidel Castro y Vd., el hermano pueblo cubano defendiera con firmeza la soberania y dignidad del pais y acelerara la construccion socialista frustrando tajantemente los desafios de toda indole y las acciones obstruccionistas de las fuerzas hostiles internas y externas. 
					
					Convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion que unen a nuestros dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran sin parar en la senda por la victoria de la causa de independencia antiimperialista y la socialista, le deseo de todo corazon a Vd. buena salud y mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades al frente del partido y el gobierno de Cuba.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a Putin
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a Putin
						
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En relacion con que los casos terroristas ocurridos en Volgograd de la Federacion Rusa causaron numerosas perdidas humanas, el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 31 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente ruso Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin.
					El remitente expresa profundas simpatias y condolencias al destinatario, los danados y sus familiares.
					
					Vuelve a exponer la posicion de la RPDC de oponerse a los actos terroristas de toda indole y expresa la solidaridad con todos los esfuerzos del gobierno y el pueblo de Rusia por eliminar cuanto antes las consecuencias del terror y asegurar la estabilidad duradera del pais.

articles.title: Departamento Obrero-Campesino del CC del FDNA publica proclama
articles.content:
Departamento Obrero-Campesino del CC del FDNA publica proclama
						
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Segun el sitio web "Frente de Salvacion Nacional", el Departamento Obrero-Campesino del Comite Central del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista (FDNA) publico el dia 29 una proclama a todos los obreros surcoreanos.
					Los obreros y otros sectores denuncian categoricamente a la banda de conservadores surcoreanos que privatiza el ferrocarril a pesar del fuerte rechazo del pueblo y convierte el territorio surcoreano en la sociedad de dictadura fascista de "Yusin", comienza la nota y continua:
					
					La huelga general de los obreros en Seul y las localidades, el acto por el "dia de accion de un millon de ciudadanos" y el viaje de protesta a Seul de mas de 30 mil obreros y sus familiares no persiguen la simple meta de impedir la privatizacion de ferrocarril sino son batallas de vida o muerte con las fuerzas dictatoriales para rescatar la democracia y el derecho a la vida.
					
					Todos deben calificar de declaracion de la "ley marcial de emergencia" de la epoca de la dictadura de "Yusin" la brutal represion de las autoridades fascistas contra los que luchan por frustrar la privatizacion de ferrocarril.
					
					Deben condenar la promesa enganosa y mentirosa de la camarilla conservadora, acabar con el "poder" testarudo y violento mediante la lucha pannacional y ampliar la lucha contra la privatizacion de ferrocarril como la batalla anti-"Partido Saenuri".
					
					Convencidos de la victoria, todos deben levantarse en la lucha por frustrar rotundamente las acciones para resucitar la dictadura de "Yusin" y construir cuanto antes un nuevo mundo y nuevo regimen democratico donde las masas trabajadoras sean duenas.
